action.action-desc: Mr. Scalise (for himself and Mr. Jody B. Hice of Georgia) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow charitable organizations to make statements relating to political campaigns if such statements are made in the ordinary course of carrying out its tax exempt purpose.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Free Speech Fairness Act.

section.header: Allowing 501(c)(3) organization to make statements relating to political campaign in ordinary course of carrying out its tax exempt purpose

subsection.text: Section 501 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Special rule relating to political campaign statements of organization described in subsection (c)(3)

paragraph.text: For purposes of subsection (c)(3) and sections 170(c)(2), 2055, 2106, 2522, and 4955, an organization shall not fail to be treated as organized and operated exclusively for a purpose described in subsection (c)(3), nor shall it be deemed to have participated in, or intervened in any political campaign on behalf of (or in opposition to) any candidate for public office, solely because of the content of any statement which—

subparagraph.text: is made in the ordinary course of the organization’s regular and customary activities in carrying out its exempt purpose, and
results in the organization incurring not more than de minimis incremental expenses.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years ending after the date of the enactment of this Act.
